snippet: French authorities on Monday deported two foreign citizens they identified as “Islamist radicals” and said three others would soon be expelled.
abstract: French authorities deport two foreign citizens they identify as 'Islamist radicals' and say three others will soon be expelled; action is in keeping with pledge by Pres Nicolas Sarkozy to quash Muslim extremism after series of killings in the Toulouse region by a man who claimed to be a member of Al Qaeda.
lead_paragraph: French authorities on Monday deported two foreign citizens they identified as “Islamist radicals” and said three others would soon be expelled.
